concept.title: What is an Array Formula
concept.shortdesc: A brief description of what an array and an array formula is and in which situation you can use them.

conbody.p: An array formula is a formula that uses as input an array of values instead of single cell value. An array formula can be seen as many formulas packed into a single super formula.

An array in Excel is a data set. This data can be in one row (a 1-dimensional horizontal array), in one column (a 1-dimensional vertical array) or in multiple rows and columns (a 2-dimensional array). Array examples
Array examples

An array formula is a formula with which you can perform multiple calculations for one or more data in an array. Array formulas are formulas that can produce multiple results for an outcome. The result is a row with values, a column with values or a table with values. To use array formulas you should first think about how many results there are and how these are arranged (one cell, one row, one column or one table).

Array formulas are also called CSE-formulas because you have to press on the CTRL+SHIFT+ENTER keys to enter them. After entering these shortcut keys braces are placed around the formula automatically.

note.p: Array formulas are identified by the braces around the formula. Never type these braces yourself, they are placed automatically by Excel.
